Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LaQuinta in Indianapolis near the airport and it was very nice. The room was clean and attractive-- and I liked the granite sink and window sill. The service from the desk person was freindly and helpful. We did not eat breakfast there but I did have coffee and it was not as good as I would have liked. But otherwise this was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rob2159
Reviews.Content: So great to find a nice motel at a reasonable price. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star because of no pool or hot tub but if that doesn't matter to you then consider this property. Nice flat screen tv's, clean, good bed and furnishings, good free breakfest, good service. Location can be hard to find if your from out of town so check maps.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for travelers with dogs”
Reviews.Author: TCallard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while traveling across the country with two kids & two dachshunds. The price for a double room was much less per night than we paid on this trip for other similarly rated accommodations along the interstates - a really good value. The room was clean & quiet, and the continental breakfast was fine. You can't beat LaQuinta's free pet policy. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great price”
Reviews.Author: merkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 days last weekend. The room and surroundings were very neat and clean. Great price for the weekend. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel was very good also. We had a great meal at The Library restaurant across the street on Friday night although friends had a poor experience on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value to park and fly!”
Reviews.Author: gordonfangirl
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were greeted promptly by front desk staff, asked what time we would like the shuttle for the following morning, and given directions to our room. The room was clean and quiet which was all we required for the night as our flight was very early the next morning. The only drawback was the next morning we were told the "shuttle was full" and a taxi would be called for us. Very cramped in the taxi with 4 adults with luggage and a wheelchair for my daughter that had just had surgery. We NEVER saw a shuttle, and I doubt seriously that they even have one.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every time we fly!”
Reviews.Author: ALKite
Reviews.Content: I originally found this La Quinta through the Park Sleep Fly website, and my large group used it when flying out for a cruise. We loved it so much that we've used it 3 times since then, as have others in our group. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The shuttle to the airport is VERY well organized!! Clean rooms, nice breakfast, and you HAVE to try Indy's restaurant right next door. Show them your room key for a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stays”
Reviews.Author: kmrosenkoetter
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were on our way to Purdue and our flight was going to arrive very late and we decided to stay in Indianapolis before heading north. The price was great at $39 a night and the airport location was wonderful. The hotel is located in a "business park" which was just okay and there is nothing around as far as restaurants or markets. The lobby is nothing special and the common hallways were pretty beat up, but the room was great. it was very nice and had Aveda bathroom products. In all we travelled for one week at four different hotels and this hotel had the Best pillows and hot shower with great water pressure. The free breakfast was very nice, lots of serve yourself choices. I would stay here again, though I would bring food from the airpport or somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: jrtexas
Reviews.Content: A rundown overused hotel. I went there to meet my father who was flying in from TX. The room smelled really bad and when I turned down the bed I found tiny little insects (fleas) crawling all around on the bed. They have a great pet program but not so good for the next people in the room. Went to the front desk and checked out. Front desk person was very nice and made sure I wasn't charged for the room. Found the last room at a nearby hotel with a no pet policy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally well-maintained, completely clean, and comfortable. The rooms are large and quiet. The temperature control was good. We select this chain because of their liberal pet policy (no charge).

Reviews.Title: “fine stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to be close to the airport for an early flight. Room was clean and adequate. I rented from Thrifty car rental and they dropped me at the hotel so I didnt have to pay for another day of rental. This hotel has complimentary shuttle to the airport. This got me there in 5 minutes. I was too early for the breakfast so didnt have that. Staff was friendly. Would stay there again. beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: jasonx
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a couple days visiting family. This made for a good home base while we drove around Indy. Hotel is older and needs to be updated, but rooms are clean and staff is friendly. It's very close to the airport and reasonably priced. The free continental breakfast was great with cereal, eggs, waffles, fruit, bagels, etc. There isn’t a restaurant on onsite, but next door at the Adam’s Mark is the Marker Sports Bar/Restaurant. The Adam’s Mark also has a small convenience store. Besides that, not much else within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, Awful, Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Purrcy
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight because we had an early flight out of Indy the next morning. We had stayed here before and weren't impressed, but the convenience made it tolerable. That was not the case this time. The bed was horrible -- one of those cheap fake mattresses that have a hard edge. We got a very poor quality of sleep, not exactly how you want to start a vacation. Then, we took their shuttle to the airport the next morning and the driver was extremely rude to us and the other passengers. We were the only ones who tipped her and problably shouldn't have after the way she acted. We just didn't want to lower ourselves to her level. When we returned from vacation, we called the hotel and told them we were outside on the curb with our luggage and even though the hotel is less than a quarter of a mile away, we waited at least 20 min. for the van to show up. We watched the Holiday Inn, Day's Inn and Adam's Mark vans circle the airport numerous times, pick up passengers and return to the airport again while we waited. Then, when the driver arrived, we waved to him to signal that we were his passengers and he stopped at the very end of the pull-up area even though the curb area in front of us was unoccupied because we were the only ones still waiting on a shuttle. We had to pull our luggage clear to the end of area while he stood and waited on us never offering to help. Then we rode to the hotel with the air conditioning turned off and only his front (driver) window open. We will not subject ourselves to this treatment again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: thaJack
Reviews.Content: The television had five ESPN channels and five other channels. Most had static in the picture and none of them were NBC? What gives? Also, the telephone in the room had so much static on it that it was unusable.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey room”
Reviews.Author: Voyager100
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this La Quinta. The shuttle driver and check-in person were friendly and helpful. The physical setting of the hotel and room was OK, but not as nice as the two La Quinta's I've stayed in previously (which were excellent). In the afternoon there were many trucks in the parking lot, which made it noisy in my ground-floor room. The most serious problem was that my room, which I'd requested to be non-smoking, smelled of smoke. There was a very strong smoke smell in parts of the hallway as well, obvious when walking past. Next time, I'd try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: Airport convenience I had an early flight so I decided to spend the night near the airport instead of driving to Indianapolis from Cincinnati early in the morning. The La Quinta was one of the less expensive choices in the area. It's close to the airport, but I never heard any airport noise in the room. The hotel is at the end of a road leading to a business office, and it's behind another hotel so it was not easy to see right away, but it's still easy to find. The building looks fairly new, and the lobby and room were clean and modern. The room itself was a typical size with two queen beds. There was enough room to move around. The bathroom was tight, but it is a bathroom after all, not a dance hall. Overall, this hotel is a good value with excellent access to the airport and I-465 and I-70. (CS)

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel in the airport area without a shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there during Formula 1 race weekend. I booked direct through the hotel's website (4 months ahead!) and was given a room with a suite. When I checked in, they gave me a standard room instead. When I clarified with them, the staff informed me that I was already getting a great price for such a busy weekend! Even though she "looked" at her computer, she was completely brushing me off even thought I had my hotel confirmation email. I decided to let it go since it was just for 1 night. Also, it's the only hotel in the airport area that does not provide a airpot shuttle bus (informed by the cabby driver). And it's only a 5 min drive to the airport! Even though it cost a flat rate of $7 to the airport, it's a nice service to have; considering ALL the other hotels in the surrounding area have it. Other than the fact they had room available for just 1 night (almost all the hotels in Indianpolis require a 2 or 3-night min stay during race day weekends) and it's relatively near the race course, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is No Good !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wew Stayed at this Place on May 31st. It absolutly Stunk ! The Rooms are dirty, the hallway stinks and the staff doesnt know what they are doing and is very unfriendly !

Reviews.Title: “In a word- yuck!”
Reviews.Author: coando
Reviews.Content: I feel like I got a real dose of "ya get what ya pay for" here at the Baymont Inn Indianapolis Airport, which I got for a priceline bid of $33. First of all, I was given a smoking room the reek of which about knocked my socks off. When I requested to be moved to a non smoking room I was told there was none available but I could try another smoking room to see if I liked it better. Gee, thanks a lot! Besides reeking of years of smoke, this room is not clean. There are lots of odd bits of whatever on the floor and even at night I can clearly see that the corners of the room and next to the walls are crusty and even have spider webs! Maybe it's a Halloween theme thing? If I hadn't already paid for this room long ago I'd be down the road looking for another hotel right now. This place is NASTY!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A nice surprise. The room was very clean and comfortable, bottled water was a nice touch. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I truly felt welcomed during my stay. This is my new place to stay in Indy.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Indianapolis Airport Executive Drive
HotelInfo.Address: 2650 Executive Drive, Indianapolis, IN 46241
